content.div:
This week the Dose.ca team tested a handful of facial moisturizers. Find out which brands made our skin feel fresh and hydrated, and which ones left us high and dry.



Lancome Genifique Youth Activating Cream Serum (Suggested retail price: $105. Available at Lancome.ca and Lancôme counters)

“I’m a big fan of the Genifique Night Repair Crème, so I was really looking forward to testing more products from this line. The serum is non-greasy and didn’t clog my pores, but because it’s so light, it couldn’t replace my regular moisturizer. Thankfully, it’s incredibly sheer and absorbs quickly, so I didn’t have to wait long before applying my regular cream on top of it. Best of all, it lived up to its promise of giving me dewy, younger-looking skin (although for that price, I was half-expecting a dermatologist to pop out of the bottle and offer me a salon-quality facial as well). This would make a great Mother’s Day gift – assuming you really, really like your mom. Rating: 5/5” –Jen McDonnell

“With the price tag on this, it's no surprise that it topped my list of favourites. From the packaging to the cream, this product was a winner from the get-go. The cream went on smooth and absorbed fast. If you've read my reviews before, scent is a huge plus in my books and the Lancôme Genifique definitely earned itself an A+. I liked it so much that I actually used it between testing the other brands. While I would have no problem recommending this formula to anyone, I definitely have some reservations telling someone to spend that much on a cream. For that reason alone, I have to dock it one mark. Rating: 4/5” - Miranda Furtado

"After experiencing three bad reactions from other test products that had the outward appearance of being A-OK for sensitive skin, I was apprehensive to try something with as extreme a promise as ‘youth activating.’ Amazingly (or maybe not considering the $105 price tag), the Lancome was my favourite of the lot. (If only it had SPF, it could be a contender for my top facial cream ever.) Despite its extreme light-weight, the Lancome is supple enough that a drop not much bigger than a peppercorn will serve your entire face. (A good thing considering the teeny 30 mL bottle.) Mild, and sparingly fragranced with a floral scent, my skin was left fully moisturized -- without any greasiness or wacky side effects. Most amazingly, it smoothed my skin and evened its tone after a single use. I hardly expect its 'youth activation' powers will make me look like a Tween Queen with repeated usage, but I’m going to give it a try, anyway. Rating: 4.5/5" -Leah Collins


Olay Complete (Suggested retail price: $15.49. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“Another slam dunk buy Olay, this moisturizer was lighter than their other products I have tried. It worked perfectly under my makeup and lasted throughout the day. Having the SPF protection helps in all seasons. My only concern would be the amount needed to cover the face and neck, however considering its reasonable price this would not prevent me from buying Olay Complete again in the future. Rating: 4/5” – Robyn Kelly

“This is the clear winner for me. I’m very pale and burn faster than a ginger so it’s great for the upcoming summer months as it includes SPF 15 for added sun protection. And bonus: it doesn’t feel greasy or smell like a sunscreen. I only needed a small amount and it went on light and dried immediately so I could continue with my morning routine right away. Non-greasy, no breakouts, affordable and widely available – I would definitely use this again. Rating: 5/5” –Bonnie Large

“Once I got past the old lady perfume scent, this was my favourite lotion of the three I tried. I only had to use a small amount and it kept my face moisturized all day long. The thing I liked best about it was that it absorbed very quickly and didn’t leave my face shiny, which is unlike my past experiences with moisturizers containing sunscreen. I would definitely use this again. Rating: 4/5” –Stephanie Woods

“This product smells strongly of sunscreen. I like the idea of a moisturizer providing sun protection, but I actually felt like I was putting sunscreen on. The texture is pretty light, but it left my skin shiny by the end of the day. I was surprised of the results from this product, because I have tried other Olay moisturizers that I love. This moisturizer is designed for normal skin and I have combination/sensitive skin, so this may have been the reason for my results. Rating: 2.5/5. –Jennifer Simone

"With my fair skin, anything with an added SPF is an instant win. That fact probably would have tempted me go easy on this product, but it turns out the Olay didn't need any help. It's great as it is. Unlike many of the other products tested, this cream was mild enough for my sensitive face. It's as light-weight as advertised, going on smooth while absorbing quickly. And not only did it keep my complexion moisturized throughout the day, it calmed the red and splotchy damage I'd previously incurred from playing guinea pig. Rating: 4/5" -Leah Collins


Vichy AqualiaThermal Aqua Gel (Suggested retail price: $35. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“Although the jar for the Vichy Aqualia looks fancy, I found it the most disappointing of all the products I tried. The gel took forever to absorb into my skin, which meant I looked shiny for about an hour after I put it on, and even after that, it felt like I had dried glue on my face for the rest of the day. The best thing I can say about it is that at least the gel goes on really well – just a tiny bit will cover your entire face. Rating: 1/5” – Kat Angus

“After giving such great reviews on the Lancôme $105 facial cream, I would highly recommend this formula as a runner-up in terms of performance and price. My skin felt hydrated and smooth all day long and it didn't leave me looking like an oil slick. The bonus with this beauty find is you only need a little (and I mean a LITTLE) of this product, to do the trick. Rating: 4/5” –Miranda Furtado

"Never mind what it actually does for your skin, there is something luxurious and therapeutic about using this product. It's intensely perfumed with an invigorating floral fragrance, and the experience of the aqua-gel itself –- which feels more like a masque than a moisturizer -- is cool and instantly refreshing. There is such a thing as too refreshing, though. The gel’s cooling sensation quickly turned into the warm tingle of a bad reaction every time I tried it. Some pronounced pink splotchiness followed. (Nature did not intend for my face to use fun and fancy beauty goops, apparently.) That said, my face was as smooth and moisturized as it was spotty. Call it even? Rating: 3/5" -Leah Collins

“While you only need a dime-sized amount for full coverage, the gel consistency versus lotion moisturizers made it feel like I was putting hand sanitizer on my face. Be prepared to wake up early to fit this product into your morning routine because it took forever to absorb enough before I could apply makeup on and it left a tacky feeling on my face. When I used it before bed, I was sticking to the pillow case and in the morning I could feel the gel residue rinsing off my face. I’m doubtful of its moisturizing capabilities as it sits on the skin instead of actually being absorbed into it. Rating: 2/5” – Bonnie Large

“I have extremely sensitive skin so I was a little skeptical about testing out a moisturizer that’s more of a gel than a lotion, but I was pleasantly surprised. It immediately made my face feel light and fresh without having to use very much. After applying the moisturizer the night before, my skin was still pretty dry in the morning, so I’m not sure if this lives up to its 24-hour hydration claim. However, after applying it again in the morning, it left my skin moisturized all day. This also seemed to help my complexion instead of making it worse. Rating 4.5/5” –Kim D’Amato

“The Vichy Aqua Gel instantly gelled with my face! It had a cooling affect and it’s true – a little dab does go a long way. It had a faint scent which was quite enjoyable and was a great addition to my overall morning skin regime. After touching my face, I recognized the smoothness this moisturizing product has to offer. I would definitely use this gel again, even as a night moisturizer. Rating: 4.5/5” –Yvonne Yip


Peter Thomas Roth Viz-1000 (Suggested retail price: $65. Available at Sephora)

“I'm still on the fence with the Peter Thomas Roth Viz-1000. The product wasn't pleasant to put on -- it took a while to set in and delayed my makeup application. But when it did finally absorb into my skin, it felt great and lasted nearly all day. Since I'm the girl to hit the snooze button as often as physically possible, I'm going to have to dock points for its slow absorption rate. Even moisturized skin can't make up for my missed beauty sleep. Rating: 3/5” - Miranda Furtado

“This product is designed to hold moisture in underneath traditional moisturizer. After testing the product for several days I found the texture was perfect; it’s very lightweight. There was no smell and I only needed a small amount to cover my face and neck. It does just as the bottle describes: locks in moisture, not just moisturizes. However, it seems like another unnecessary step to my morning/evening routine, particularly at night when I am not adding makeup. Rating: 2.5/5” – Robyn Kelly

“This little bottle packs a powerful punch of hydration. I don’t normally have dry skin, but I could definitely see the benefit of adding this serum to a beauty care regime in the harsh winter months. Like the Genifique, it’s not thick enough to replace moisturizer, but it works well underneath one. It’s great for people who suffer from flaky skin (or, unlike me, have the patience to add another step before moisturizing). Rating: 3/5” –Jen McDonnell

“This product claims to attract 1000 times its weight in water from the moisture in the air to restore your skin’s moisture. Although I only needed a small amount of this odorless serum to cover my face, it made my skin feel sticky and left no noticeable difference in moisture. I’m not sure why this supposedly moisturizing product would require an application of moisturizer afterwards, but it does. I wouldn’t use this product again because it is overpriced and adds an extra, unnecessary step to my daily makeup routine. 1/5” –Jennifer Simone


Biotherm Aquasource Cream (Suggested retail price $45. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“This isn’t marketed as a night cream, but it’s certainly thick enough to feel like one. I found this product to be way too heavy for my skin; it didn’t absorb quickly and clogged my pores (I can’t be positive, but I have a sneaking suspicion this cream is the reason I’m sporting a giant pimple on my forehead, which had, up until now, been a zit-free zone). Add the old-lady fragrance and the heavy glass packaging, and it’s a miss. Rating: 1/5” –Jen McDonnell

"Despite some prominent labeling that this stuff is 'suitable for sensitive skin,' my face proved too wimpy to benefit from a few days of Aquasource. The thickest of the lotions I tested (though super-quick to absorb), and the most heavily fragranced, Aquasource no doubt kept my skin moisturized. But at what cost? How about a red and splotchy t-zone and a mild burning sensation. About that post-application burning: It was nothing extreme; I like to compare it to the feeling of downing a shot of whiskey. (But then, who enjoys a shot of whiskey first thing in the morning?) Rating: 2/5" -Leah Collins

“I really enjoyed the fresh citrus scent of this lotion. Only a small amount was needed, and my face stayed moisturized all day. The downsides were that it left my skin a little bit shiny and it didn’t contain sunscreen. Because of the high price point, I probably wouldn’t buy this myself. Rating: 3/5” –Stephanie Woods

“The Biotherm was great -- if it was a night cream. I love the scent, the texture and the results, but for a light daytime moisturizer, it definitely went on a little too thick for my taste. Rating: 3/5” - Miranda Furtado


Kiehl's Rosa Arctica Ultra Facial Moisturizer (Suggested retail price: $32. Available at Kiehl’s)

“I wasn’t sure I was going to like this one because of its odd texture, but it ended up being my second favourite, right behind the Genifique. Unlike all the other creams and serums I tested, this mint-coloured moisturizer is a thick paste (think cold butter) that you have to warm between your fingers before applying. But I loved its light scent, cooling sensation and hydrating, non-greasy texture. The only thing missing is SPF protection. Rating: 4/5” –Jen McDonnell

“My skin has an annoying tendency to get flaky, so I often need a heavy-duty moisturizer to keep my face looking fresh – and it’s difficult to find a product that will do that without clogging my pores. But the Kiehl’s moisturizer worked perfectly; my skin was smooth as a baby’s butt all day and I didn’t break out even a little bit. The bottle looks like it was just slapped together in a housewife’s bathroom, but don’t let that fool you: if you need a good moisturizer that won’t stop working halfway through the day, the Kiehl’s is for you. Rating: 5/5” – Kat Angus

“I'm usually a huge fan of the brand, but this moisturizer didn't do anything exceptional. While the other products made the testing experience feel almost luxurious, this cream just felt like I was doing another chore. If it were on a dessert menu, it’d be the vanilla pudding next to the Crème Brule. Rating 3/5”. - Miranda Furtado

“Spackle, spackle, spackle. After using the Kiehl's Ultra Facial Moisturizer that has been around since 1851, this product made me feel like a glowing, radiant angel. It was really smooth in texture, did not smell and felt light on my face. I could use this product forever. There was no scent at all, I needed just a few drops and my face quenched its grand goodness. I did not have to reapply; it lasted the whole day. It could very well be my go-to product from now on. Rating: 4.5/5” –Yvonne Yip


The Body Shop Natrulift (Suggested retail price:$30. Available at The Body Shop)

“The product smells natural and not overly scented and you only need a dab for problematic areas. But at 31, I’m possibly too young to need an anti-ageing cream since I don’t have any crow’s feet and I don’t need a ‘firming’ cream. The Body Shop Natrulift is a really thick moisturizer and feels more like a hand cream than a face cream. I can see using this in the winter months but if you’re prone to summertime breakouts, steer clear! Rating 3/5” –Bonnie Large

“This moisturizer had a light berry scent. I didn’t need to use very much at all to cover my whole face, but it was much too heavy for my normal skin type. It didn’t really absorb properly and it left my skin shiny. I wouldn’t personally use it again but I think it would be great for someone with really dry skin. Rating: 4/5” –Stephanie Woods

“My initial impression of the Natrulift Firming Day Cream was that the texture was very thick and felt oily so I was worried about the reaction my skin would have. I found it to be too thick for me and really did not like the smell. I was also unable to apply my makeup in the morning immediately after using it as it left my skin too greasy. Overall, I really did not like this product because of the texture and smell. However, it did leave my skin feeling moisturized and did not cause me to break out. Perhaps this product would be better as a night cream instead of a day cream. Rating: 3/5” –Kim D’Amato

“When I smelled this product I was reluctant to put it on my face, but I was pleasantly surprised. It’s rich in texture and glides on easily, giving my skin the feeling of added moisture that lasts throughout the day. I only needed a small amount of this concentrated cream to achieve complete coverage, making it worth the splurge. I recommend this product for combination/sensitive skin types that require extra care. Rating: 3.5/5” –Jennifer Simone

“I’m not quite old enough to really need a firming cream (I hope), but the Natrulift still made my face feel soft and moisturized all day long. The warm-butter consistency took a little getting used to, but once that hurdle was cleared, the Natrulift worked great as a day cream. And the pomegranate smells amazing! If only the cream had SPF protection, too. Rating: 4/5” – Kat Angus
